details.name: Citi
details.description: The ideal candidate has strong technical expertise, attention to detail, and a passion for creating and deploying solutions. We are seeking a skilled Developer with experience in Angular, JavaScript, and Java Microservices to join our team.<br><br>Key Responsibilities<br><br><ul><li>Develop responsive, high-quality applications using Angular and JavaScript</li><li>Integrate with Java Microservices and cloud environments (OpenShift or similar)</li><li>Write and maintain comprehensive test cases to ensure quality, functionality, and reliability</li><li>Participate in the build, deployment, and testing cycle, ensuring smooth delivery of new features</li><li>Collaborate with designers, product owners, and backend teams to align business and technical goals<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li>Strong proficiency in Angular and JavaScript</li><li>Experience with Java Microservices development and integration</li><li>Familiarity with cloud platforms (OpenShift or equivalent)</li><li>Knowledge of content management systems (CMS) and how to integrate them with front-end frameworks</li><li>Solid understanding of test-driven development and best practices in code testing</li><li>Experience in CI/CD build and deployment processes</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work in a collaborative team environment<br><br></li></ul>About Citi:<br><br>Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments, and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.<br><br>As a bank with a brain and a soul, Citi creates economic value that is systemically responsible and in our clients’ best interests. As a financial institution that touches every region of the world and every sector that shapes your daily life, our Operations &amp; Technology teams are charged with a mission that rivals any large tech company. Our technology solutions are the foundations of everything we do from keeping the bank safe, managing global resources, and providing the technical tools our workers need to be successful to designing our digital architecture and ensuring our platforms provide a first-class customer experience. We reimagine client and partner experiences to deliver excellence through secure, reliable, and efficient services.<br><br>Our commitment to diversity includes a workforce that represents the clients we serve from all walks of life, backgrounds, and origins. We foster an environment where the best people want to work. We value and demand respect for others, promote individuals based on merit, and ensure opportunities for personal development are widely available to all. Ideal candidates are innovators with well-rounded backgrounds who bring their authentic selves to work and complement our culture of delivering results with pride. If you are a problem solver who seeks passion in your work, come join us. We’ll enable growth and progress together.<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Job Family Group: <br><br></strong>Technology<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Job Family:<br><br></strong>Digital Software Engineering<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Time Type:<br><br></strong>Full time<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Primary Location:<br><br></strong>Irving Texas United States<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Primary Location Full Time Salary Range:<br><br></strong>$84,580.00 - $118,020.00<br><br>In addition to salary, Citi’s offerings may also include, for eligible employees, discretionary and formulaic incentive and retention awards. Citi offers competitive employee benefits, including: medical, dental &amp; vision coverage; 401(k); life, accident, and disability insurance; and wellness programs. Citi also offers paid time off packages, including planned time off (vacation), unplanned time off (sick leave), and paid holidays. For additional information regarding Citi employee benefits, please visit citibenefits.com. Available offerings may vary by jurisdiction, job level, and date of hire.<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Most Relevant Skills<br><br></strong>Please see the requirements listed above.<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Other Relevant Skills<br><br></strong>For complementary skills, please see above and/or contact the recruiter.<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><strong>Anticipated Posting Close Date:<br><br></strong>Oct 27, 2025<br><br>------------------------------------------------------<br><br><em>Citi is an equal opportunity employer, and qualified candidates will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br></em><em>If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.<br><br>View Citi’s EEO Policy Statement and the Know Your Rights poster.</em>

criteria.industry: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Banking

details.name: Toyota North America
details.description: Magnit Direct Sourcing on behalf of Toyota is currently hiring for a Front End Developer for a temporary assignment in Plano, TX.<br><br>This position is a 6 Month contract assignment. The pay range for this role is between 70.00/hr - $75.00/Hr. Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K.<br><br><strong>Who We Are<br><br></strong>Collaborative. Respectful. A place to dream and do. These are just a few words that describe what life is like at Toyota. As one of the world’s most admired brands, Toyota is growing and leading the future of mobility through innovative, high-quality solutions designed to enhance lives and delight those we serve. We’re looking for diverse, talented team members who want to Dream. Do. Grow. with us.<br><br><strong>What We’re Looking For<br><br></strong><ul><li>The Front-End Developer will primarily be responsible for collaborating and providing technical support.<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You’ll Be Doing<br><br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with the lead developer to write and modify browser-based applications.</li><li>Provide technical support to users of automation tools.</li><li>Ensure quality assurance, troubleshoot issues, and contribute to the development of automation solutions for automotive multimedia head units.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications/ What You Bring (Must Haves)<br><br></strong><ul><li>3-5 years’ experience in front-end development.</li><li>Hands on React experience.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Agile methodologies.</li><li>Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to identify root causes and resolve issues promptly.</li><li>Proactive approach to improving tools and workspace efficiency.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and communication skills; ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.</li><li>Web Technologies: Strong expertise in HTML5, CSS5, TypeScript, JSON, REST, Nodejs and React is required to effectively contribute to our web development projects.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Added Bonus If You Have (Preferred)<br><br></strong><ul><li>Experience in cloud-based web development.</li><li>Familiarity with automated testing for automotive multimedia systems.</li><li>Testing Frameworks: Vitest or similar.</li><li>Build Tools: Turborepo, Redux or similar.</li><li>UX experience.<br><br></li></ul>Talented, dedicated people are an integral part of our mission to build the best workforce, working together to create the future of mobility and make the world a better place. We are always on the lookout for diverse, driven, and collaborative talent interested in performing contract work for Toyota.<br><br>Click here to join our talent network and be the first in line when a new contingent job opportunity opens at Toyota through Magnit Direct Sourcing.<br><br>Magnit is an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.<br><br><strong>QUALIFICATION/LICENSURE<br><br></strong><strong>Work Authorization :</strong> Green Card, US Citizen<br><br><strong>Preferred years of experience :</strong> 3 years<br><br><strong>Travel required :</strong> No travel required<br><br><strong>Shift timings :</strong> 9 AM to 5 PM

details.name: Topaz Labs
details.description: We&apos;re Topaz Labs, an AI tech company that builds one-click image and video quality software with deep learning. Over 1M photographers and designers trust us with their work, including teams at Google, Nvidia, NASA, and more. We&apos;ve processed over 1 billion images, achieved 1800% revenue growth in the last 6 years, but we&apos;re just getting started.<br><br><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>We&apos;re experiencing rocketship growth and opportunity for impact ($3M → $45M revenue in four years). Over 1 million customers (including companies like Apple, NASA, Netflix) have used us for over 1 billion photos. Our tech has been covered by Fast Company, The Verge, Engadget, Mashable, BBC, and more. Our world-class team executes quickly, obsesses about the customer experience, and promotes from within. We&apos;re profitable with infinite runway.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>As a Software Engineer on our Product Applications team, you would be a key part developing both web-based applications enabling users to upgrade the quality of their images and videos online. Your responsibilities would include feature development, code and system architecture, project planning, UI/UX, stability, optimization and more. Our product engineers work on everything from application architecture to frontend features. At Topaz, we put a high value on the craftsmanship of the user experience in our products: they need to be simple enough for anyone to use, but advanced enough for a professional photographer to obsess over every pixel. Our goal is to deliver a premium experience to our users at a consistent, rapid pace.<br><br><strong>About You<br><br></strong><ul><li>3+ years of professional dev exp</li><li>Proficient HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, and at least one object oriented programming language</li><li>Understanding of browser internals and how to leverage browser features such as WebCodecs, Canvas, Web Workers, etc. to build a rich and performant interface</li><li>Very deep knowledge of at least 1 UI framework such as React, Vue, or Svelte</li><li>Low-level - application architecture, networking, databases, performance and optimization</li><li>Ability to build APIs needed to power frontend experience</li><li>Good understanding of concurrency and multi-threading</li><li>Eye for design and a high level of craftsmanship</li><li>Strong, independent team member. Likes to have a high level of responsibility</li><li>Experience writing UI, Integration, and Acceptance tests<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br><br></strong><ul><li>Exposure to image or video encoding/decoding and file formats</li><li>Experience developing full stack web applications using Next.js, Nuxt.js, Remix, SvelteKit, or another framework</li><li>Experiencing deploying ML models in production environments<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>Love<br><br></strong><ul><li>Photographers and videographers!</li><li>Deep knowledge of image file formats - JPEG, RAW, TIFF, PNG…</li><li>Familiarity with these SDKs - ONNX, CoreML, TensorRT, OpenVino</li><li>Advanced use of ffmpeg, OpenCV<br><br><br></li></ul><em>Do you meet most but not 100% of the above? We’d still like to hear from you–we are passionate about developing a diverse team and culture, so please apply if you’re interested!<br><br></em>This is a unique role for someone interested in making a deep impact at a high-growth tech software company. We offer strong base salary, plus significant ownership that scales with the company&apos;s growth. We also offer 100% covered medical/dental/vision for employees, 15 days annual PTO plus holidays, and 401k matching. This is a full-time onsite role in Dallas, TX, and we will ask you to relocate if you&apos;re not in the area<br><br>We may use artificial intelligence (AI) tools to support parts of the hiring process, such as reviewing applications, analyzing resumes, or assessing responses. These tools assist our recruitment team but do not replace human judgment. Final hiring decisions are ultimately made by humans. If you would like more information about how your data is processed, please contact us.

details.name: Koddi
details.description: <strong>About Koddi<br><br></strong>We are a global technology company with software and services that help top digital marketplaces effectively monetize their first-party audiences through industry-leading commerce media technology and strategy. Our enterprise platforms leverage first-party data to drive marketplace revenue and profit by improving user experience and target shoppers throughout the purchase path. Koddi’s platforms enable any advertiser, any marketplace, in any industry to increase awareness, generate demand, and drive revenue. We are committed to driving innovation and growth in the commerce media space.<br><br>As part of that commitment, we’ve launched Koddi Academy, a learning platform designed to provide expert knowledge, competitive insights, and practical strategies for thriving in this fast-growing industry. Explore our latest certification course, to deepen your expertise and stay ahead in the evolving world of commerce media.<br><br>You can also sign up for our waiting list to be notified when new courses are released. Get started today at Koddi Academy.<br><br><strong>Junior Software Engineering Cohort<br><br></strong>Koddi is excited to announce an Engineering training program geared towards recent graduates with Statistics or Computer Science degrees as well as recent grads who have completed coding bootcamps! The Koddi Cohort Program is an intensive 8-week training program starting February 2nd 2026 that includes all aspects of Engineering at Koddi. In addition to technical training during this program, and on an ongoing basis, we will also provide instructor-led and self-paced leadership development opportunities.<br><br><strong>Program Highlights<br><br></strong><ul><li>Begins February 2nd, 2026, running 8 weeks long</li><li>Work with industry-leading experts to gain hands-on knowledge and experience</li><li>Gain a comprehensive understanding of the Koddi business</li><li>Have the opportunity to share and present ideas with team members</li><li>Participate in leadership workshops and soft skill development</li><li>Receive executive mentorship and peer-to-peer support throughout the program<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Do<br><br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with a team of software engineers, contributing to an agile environment</li><li>Write clean, organized, and maintainable code </li><li>Assist in developing tools and libraries to support automation efforts</li><li>Support product features through various stages of development and deployment</li><li>Learn and apply software best practices while incorporating new technologies</li><li>Work with the product management and program teams to help define feature specifications and contribute to product development</li><li>Participate in analyzing and improving system efficiency and scalability</li><li>Ensure that business requirements are met by assisting in the creation and execution of automated tests</li><li>Contribute to technical discussions and actively participate in team problem-solving sessions<br><br></li></ul><strong>What You'll Bring<br><br></strong><ul><li>Graduating with a Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science or successful completion of relevant bootcamp coursework</li><li>Graduation/Bootcamp completion date no later than December 2025</li><li>Demonstrated software engineering experience from previous internship, work experience, coding competitions, or publications</li><li>Experience with web application development, distributed and parallel systems, developing large software systems, or security software development</li><li>Demonstrate proficiency in data analysis, programming and software engineering</li><li>Ability to produce high quality code with good test coverage, using modern abstractions and frameworks</li><li>Experience in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms and software design</li><li>Experience programming in two or more of the following languages: C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, Kotlin, Go, Python, Typescript or similar</li><li>Work independently, use available resources to get unblocked, and complete tasks on-schedule by exercising strong judgment and problem solving skills</li><li>Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Excellent communication skills and eagerness to learn </li><li>Enjoys working in a fast paced environment with high collaboration</li><li>Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment</li><li>Availability to be onsite for the duration of the program Monday-Friday in our Fort Worth office</li><li>Availability to work Full Time after the cohort program</li></ul>

details.name: Toyota North America
details.description: Magnit Direct Sourcing on behalf of Toyota is currently hiring for a Full Stack Developer for a temporary assignment in Plano, TX.<br><br>This is a 12 month contract position. The pay range for this role is between $66.00/hr - $85.00/Hr. Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K.<br><br><strong>What we’re looking for</strong>We are seeking a talented and passionate Full Stack Developer to join our dynamic Agile team. In this role, you'll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support scalable web applications. Your contributions will have a significant impact on the advancement of our technological solutions and infrastructure of Toyota Connected Technologies.<strong>What you’ll be doing<br><br></strong><ul><li>Collaborate within and across Agile teams to deliver high-quality, innovative web applications.</li><li>App design and writing efficient code under the guidance of Senior Developers based on detailed specifications, user stories, and business requirements.</li><li>Debug issues, participate in code reviews, write comprehensive unit tests, and perform integration and end-to-end testing to ensure software quality.</li><li>Thoroughly document code through clear comments, maintain up-to-date Confluence documentation, and regularly update user guides for clarity and ease of use.</li><li>Actively participate in the software release process, supporting the deployment of new code to production as planned by the Product Owner.</li><li>Engage proactively in all scrum meetings, team meetings, developer discussions, and brainstorming sessions to foster collaborative problem-solving and continuous improvement.</li><li>Develop and maintain robust front-end and back-end solutions using React, Angular, JavaScript, Java, and Spring-based APIs.</li><li>Employ Test-Driven Development (TDD) methodologies for both application code and infrastructure automation to ensure robust, maintainable, and reliable systems.</li><li>Utilize AWS services extensively (CloudFront, Lambda, DynamoDB, EC2, S3, ELB, RDS, EKS) to architect comprehensive full-stack cloud solutions.</li><li>Build and optimize large-scale, complex web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and cloud content delivery tools and CDNs.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications/ What you bring (Must Haves) – Highlight Top 3-5 skills<br><br></strong><ul><li>Extensive experience in full-stack software development, particularly using React, Angular, JavaScript, Java, and Spring frameworks.</li><li>Deep knowledge and hands-on experience in microservices, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and cloud computing (AWS).</li><li>Proven experience utilizing AWS services (CloudFront, Lambda, DynamoDB, EC2, S3, ELB, RDS, EKS).</li><li>Demonstrated capability to build scalable, performant web applications and familiarity with CDNs.</li><li>Passionate about technology, innovation, and continuous improvement, actively participating in tech communities.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Added bonus if you have (Preferred):<br><br></strong><ul><li>Experience using JIRA/Confluence tools</li><li>Proficient in Github/Gitlab CI/CD<br><br></li></ul>Talented, dedicated people are an integral part of our mission to build the best workforce, working together to create the future of mobility and make the world a better place. We are always on the lookout for diverse, driven, and collaborative talent interested in performing contract work for Toyota.<br><br>Click here to join our talent network and be the first in line when a new contingent job opportunity opens at Toyota through Magnit Direct Sourcing.<br><br>Magnit is an equal opportunity employer, and all applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.<br><br><strong>QUALIFICATION/LICENSURE<br><br></strong><strong>Work Authorization :</strong> Green Card, US Citizen<br><br><strong>Preferred years of experience :</strong> 4 years<br><br><strong>Travel required :</strong> No travel required<br><br><strong>Shift timings :</strong> 9 AM to 5 PM

details.name: JobTread Software
details.description: JobTread Software<br><br>JavaScript Developer<br><br>Full Time<br><br>On Location in Dallas, Texas<br><br>Base Salary + Bonus<br><br><strong>Job Summary<br><br></strong>JobTread is pioneering the construction management software industry, offering a suite of comprehensive tools that boost efficiency and profitability in construction projects. As a company known for its rapid growth and strong team culture, we are looking for a JavaScript Developer to enhance our product's connectivity and functionality to other applications.<br><br>As a JavaScript Developer, you will focus on creating seamless connections between our platform and various external systems and services. This role is essential in ensuring our software integrates effectively, enhancing our user experience and connectivity with complementary products.<br><br>As a member of the JobTread Development Team, you'll be surrounded by a small group of rockstars. If you are eager to contribute to a team that values innovation and excellence, we would love to hear from you. Join us in revolutionizing construction management and build a successful career at JobTread!<br><br>Key Responsibilities<br><br><ul><li>Develop and maintain integrations between JobTread and third-party services</li><li>Work closely with development and product teams to design and implement API-based integrations</li><li>Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to integrations to ensure optimal functionality</li><li>Collaborate on API design and architecture discussions</li><li>Maintain up-to-date API docs and knowledge base<br><br></li></ul>Ideal Candidate<br><br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field</li><li>Minimum of 3 years experience in software development, with a strong focus on API integrations</li><li>Proficient in JavaScript</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail</li><li>Highly motivated self-starter with a desire to add a ton of value<br><br></li></ul>Perks<br><br><ul><li>Join a small, growing team as an early team member.</li><li>Upward career mobility at a high-growth startup.</li><li>Make an impact and advance your career development.</li><li>Opportunity to become an innovator and solve real-world problems for construction.</li><li>Creative and entrepreneurial working environment</li><li>Work every day with successful, smart, and highly motivated people.</li><li>Electronic standing/sitting desks with top of the line secondary monitors.</li><li>Weekly Team Lunch, Happy Hours, and other team events.</li><li>Casual dress code.</li><li>Flexible schedule.<br><br></li></ul>Benefits &amp; Pay<br><br><ul><li>$125K-$150K/year + $10K-$20K bonus</li><li>Dental, health, and vision insurance</li><li>Paid training</li><li>401k plan + matching</li><li>Vacation and other Paid Time Off</li><li>Free access to an onsite workout facility<br><br></li></ul><strong>About JobTread<br><br></strong>JobTread provides end-to-end construction management software that helps construction businesses manage all of their processes, from pre-construction through to project completion.<br><br>Our full suite of features includes everything construction businesses need to manage their jobs, team members, documents, photos, customers, vendors, and sub-contractors all in one place. And our budget-first approach creates financial transparency at every stage of a project. Get organized, complete your projects on time, and increase your profits with JobTread.<br><br>JobTread's mission is to leverage technology to create more profitable construction companies. Come be a part of the fun and challenging environment at our headquarters conveniently located in Dallas, TX right off Interstate 635 &amp; Coit Rd.<br><br>JobTread is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

details.name: ICE
details.description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong><strong>Job Purpose<br><br></strong>As a Front-End Engineer with the ICE Simplifile Submitter Team, you will apply your knowledge of software development methodologies, best practices, problem solving and industry experience to work with the team in maintaining, refactoring and evolving the eRecording submitter workflow and developing necessary supporting tools. Your work will primarily be with the front-end portion of the Simplifile SAAS platform technology stack.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong><ul><li>Responsible for assisting with all phases of the project life cycle including implementation, programming, testing and maintaining software systems.</li><li>Help build high-quality, innovative, and fully performing software that complies with coding standards and technical design.</li><li>Ensure high quality code via design reviews, code reviews and unit test coverage.</li><li>Support process improvements which guide development activities.</li><li>Work with the product organization to identify scope of work and feasible timelines, prioritize work, and allocate available resources.</li><li>Solve straightforward problems in development and provide solutions based on technical standards, practices, and existing precedents or procedures.</li><li>Work effectively with members of the team, gaining understanding of development processes.</li><li>Frequent interaction with team and management to resolve issues or inquiries related to development; improve processes and procedures where possible.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge And Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, engineering, or related field.</li><li>3+ years’ experience with relevant software stack and processes.</li><li>Experience in JavaScript programming language.</li><li>Experience with front-end web technologies, preferably Angular.</li><li>Proficiency in HTML5, CSS</li><li>Familiar with modern software development tools and processes.</li><li>Familiar with backend technologies, such as Java and MySQL a plus.</li><li>Detail-oriented and good organizational skills.</li><li>Great communication skills.</li><li>Able to work in a team environment.</li><li>Able to communicate and navigate effectively with internal and external customers to resolve technical issues and collaborate on new projects and integrations.</li></ul>

details.name: GovEase
details.description: GovEase is seeking a Software Developer to play a key role in building innovative, high-performance web applications that make government processes simpler and faster. We’re looking for a passionate developer skilled in ASP.NET, C#, SQL Server, and modern web technologies like JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS—someone who thrives on solving complex challenges and delivering clean, scalable solutions.  <br><br><br>Requirements<br><br><p>Skill Requirements <br></p><ul> <li>Microsoft Windows Server <br> </li> <li>Microsoft ASP (ASP.net core, Console EXE apps, .net Windows local Apps, C#, etc.) <br> </li> <li>Microsoft SQL Server. Transact SQL (TSQL): SQL statements, stored procs, tables, views, triggers, etc. <br> </li> <li>Web Services, API development, JSON, XML, Restful, etc. <br> </li> <li>DHTML, AJAX, JavaScript , JSON, HTML5, CSS, etc. <br> </li> <li>Microsoft Visual Studio IDE <br> </li> <li>Microsoft source control systems: Team Foundation Server (TFS), DevOps, etc.High online traction processing programming (OLTP). HTTP load testing, etc. <br> </li> <li>Credit card processing gateways and technologies. Banking integrations.  <br> </li> <li>Good communication skills. Good documentation skills. <br> </li> <li>Can work well within a team and can also handle individual tasks end-to-end. <br> </li></ul><p>Experience Requirements <br></p><ul> <li>2+ years’ experience developing web-based software / applications using Microsoft technologies. <br> </li> <li>Good knowledge of the .NET framework, ASP.NET and web technologies (JavaScript, jQuery, CSS, AJAX, and HTML).  <br> </li> <li>Good TSQL skills are required (Stored procedures, tables, views, etc.).  <br> </li> <li>Existing work authorization in the US for any employer (Green card, US Citizen, etc.) <br> </li></ul><p>Other: <br></p><ul> <li>Salary commensurate with experience. <br> </li> <li>Working in an office environment in Allen, TX with flexibility to work hybrid <br> <br><br><br></li></ul>Benefits<br><br><ul> <li>Competitive Salary <br> </li> <li>Blue Cross &amp; Blue Shield Health Insurance <br> </li> <li>Guardian Dental Insurance <br> </li> <li>Long-Term Disability Insurance <br> </li> <li>Optional Vision Insurance <br> </li> <li>401(k) Discretionary Matching Plan <br> </li> <li>Generous Paid Time Off, Sick Days, &amp; Company Holidays <br> </li> <li>Voluntary Benefits: Short-Term Disability, Life Insurance (Whole or Term), Accident Insurance, Hospital Indemnity Insurance, Cancer Insurance, Critical Illness Insurance. <br> </li></ul><p> <br></p><p>GovEase is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. GovEase will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law.<br><br><br><br></p>

details.name: Ericsson
details.description: <strong>Grow with us<br><br></strong>Ericsson Inc. does not sponsor US work authorization for this job position including H-1B, O-1, L-1 and TN. Ericsson also does not hire F-1’s working on EAD for this position.<br><br>Software Developer Intern<br><br>Location: Plano, TX<br><br><strong>About this opportunity:<br><br></strong>As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology. This is a place where you're welcomed as your own perfectly unique self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team. Come, and be where it begins.<br><br>In this exciting opportunity you will be working with our Managed Services Application Development and Modernization (ADM) Team which does provide<br><br><ul><li> Solution Delivery and Life-cycle Management for evolving technologies such as Microservices, Ansible, Scripting languages like Python, Automation, Java etc.</li><li> Drive efficiency from the inside out by enabling DevSecOps and Automation culture at both Customer and Ericsson side</li><li> Categorize customization and assets reuse potential that shall be part of future product roadmap.</li><li> Continually build our competence and capabilities to deliver exceptional services and Business Agility</li><li> Working in a SAFe Agile environment</li><li> Exposure to customer environments and ways of working with the customer</li><li> Opportunities to learn different stages of software lifecycle<br><br></li></ul><strong>What you will do:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Work with program leadership &amp; Technical Leads to accelerate innovation and Automations by developing and refining strategy, creating proof-of-concepts to address customer challenges</li><li> You will take high level ideas and direction and create functional prototypes to showcase capabilities to our customers in the Automation (Test Automation, Deployment Automation), Microservices, Containers, call processing and routing</li><li> You will effectively use your abilities in innovating, software development, DevOps, security, integration, configuration, analytics, deployment, and production support<br><br></li></ul><strong>The skills you bring:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Domain knowledge in AI/ML, Automation, Large SAFe, Process Automation, Containerization, Microservices</li><li> Knowledge in System Engineering, programming and quality assurance</li><li> Knowledge in technologies and Programming languages – Java, C/C++, RDBMS, Python, Ansible</li><li> Some Experience in DevOps</li><li> Cloud infrastructure: AWS (Amazon Web Services) or similar</li><li> Virtual Environments: RHEL, Windows, etc.</li><li> Containers: Docker, Kubernetes etc.</li><li> Automation &amp;
